FORM 0-/
SOUTHERN
EXIT LOCATIONS
AIRWAYS
MARTIN 404
EVACUATION PROCEDURES
Forward
Cargo Door
TO OUR PASSENGERS
You are flying aboard a Martin 404 with a skilled and
experienced Captain and Crew who are thoroughly
trained to
cope with
and handle any
emergehcy
situation which might arise.
Aircraft emergencies are infrequent; however, pro-
cedures have been established in advance as pre-
cautionary measures.
To acquaint yourself with the safety
features
of
this airplane, we ask that you familiarize yourself
with the information provided on this card.
In the event of an emergency, remain calm. Listen
and follow carefully the instructions given by your
Stewardess or other Crew Members.
SEAT BELTS
Seat belts are provided for your safety and comfort.
They must be fastened securely during all taxiings,
takeoffs and landings. It is recommended that your
seat belt be fastened at any time you are seated.
Seats must be in an upright position during all:
takeoffs, and landings.
SMOKING
Whenever the "NO SMOKING" sign is on, all smokes
are to be extinguished.
LIFE VESTS
Life Vests are located in a pouch under each seat
for use in the event of an emergency water landing.
REGULATIONS PROHIBIT THE
USE OF ANY AM OR
FM RADIO OR TV RECEIVERS IN FLIGHT.
DO NOT REMOVE THIS CARD FROM AIRCRAFT
FORWARD CARGO DOOR
The Forward Cargo Door is
equipped with an inflatable
emergency evacuation slide.
Operation Procedures:
1. Rotate Handle in direction of
arrow to "OPEN."
2.
3.
Push door outward.
Grasp Red Handle on floor and
pull to inflate evacuation slide.
EVACUATION SLIDE
Before using slide, remove high-
heeled shoes.
The correct way to use slide is to
sit on sill and push off, feet first.
Do not hold onto sides of slide
and in no instance jump onto it.
Window
Window
Exit
Exit
Window
abs door
WINDOW EXIT OPERATION
1. Insert Hand in Slot
2. Pull Handle down
3. Grasp Bottom and Top
of Window
4. Lift inward.
BRACING POSITION
